bill local government bill hl contents prevention of implementation of certain proposals for single tier of local government extent, commencement and short title bill local government bill hl a b i l l to prevent the implementation of existing proposals made for the purposes of part of the local government and public involvement in health act . e it enacted by the queen s most excellent majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the lords spiritual and temporal, and commons, in this present parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows prevention of implementation of certain proposals for single tier of local government after the commencement of this act, no further relevant order may be made under section of the act . in this section a relevant order means an order implementing a proposal received by the secretary of state before the commencement of this act; the act means the local government and public involvement in health act . extent, commencement and short title this act extends to england and wales only. this act comes into force on the day on which it is passed. this act may be cited as the local government act . b

manchester city council act chapter iii contents introductory citation interpretation application application of act provision of services pedlars seizure and forfeiture seizure return and disposal of seized items forfeiture of seized items compensation where seizure unlawful elizabeth ii c. iii manchester city council act chapter iii an act to confer powers on manchester city council for the better control of street trading in the city of manchester. th april whereas the city of manchester is a district under the management and local government of manchester city council certain powers relating to street trading in the city are exercisable by the council under the local government act and for their better enforcement it is expedient to amend that act in its application to manchester and supplement those powers the objects of this act cannot be attained without the authority of parliament in relation to the promotion of the bill for this act the requirements of section of the local government act have been observed may it therefore please your majesty that it may be enacted, and be it enacted, by the queen s most excellent majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the lords spiritual and temporal, and commons, in this present parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows introductory citation this act may be cited as the manchester city council act . manchester city council act interpretation in this act the act means the local government act ; authorised of cer means an of cer of the council authorised by the council in writing to act for the purposes of this act; the chief constable means the chief constable of the greater manchester police force; the city means the city of manchester; the council means the manchester city council; equipment means equipment used for the purposes of street trading; proper of cer has the same meaning as in section of the local government act ; receptacle includes any vehicle, trailer or barrow; and any basket, bag, box, vessel, stall, stand, easel, board, tray or other thing, which is used as a container for or for the display of any article; a relevant offence means an offence under paragraph of schedule to the act; or of aiding, abetting, counselling or procuring the commission of an offence under that paragraph, committed on or after the day on which this act came into force. application this act applies so long as any resolution by the council under section of the act remains in force. application of act provision of services in their application to the city, the provisions of schedule to the act shall apply with the following modi cations. in paragraph , for the de nition of street trading , there is substituted street trading means, subject to sub paragraph below the selling or exposing or offering for sale of any article in a street; or the supplying of or offering to supply any service in a street for gain or reward; and . in paragraph after articles in both places where it appears there is inserted or services . in paragraph after goods there is inserted or services . in paragraph after articles there is inserted or services . manchester city council act pedlars subject to subsection , in their application to the city, the provisions of schedule to the act shall apply as if in paragraph of that schedule there were inserted, after the reference to the pedlars act , the words , if the trading is carried out only by means of visits from house to house, with any goods or handicraft equipment carried on his person as a pedestrian, or with any goods or handicraft equipment carried in a wheeled vehicle pushed or pulled by him, and or of this paragraph applies , he complies with the essential requirements referred to in sub paragraph below, as read with sub paragraphs and below , and after paragraph of that schedule there were inserted the following sub paragraphs subject to sub paragraph a person complies with the essential requirements as follows he must leave any location that he is occupying with a view to trading no later than ve minutes after arrival there, unless he begins trading on arrival there, in which case he must leave no later than at the end of the ve minute period, or as soon as he is able after trading ceases, whichever comes later; each location he occupies with a view to trading must be at a minimum distance of metres from his previous one; each location he occupies in any hour period with a view to trading must be at a minimum distance of metres away from any other one that he has so occupied at any time in that period; he must not begin so to occupy a location any part of which is nearer than a minimum distance of metres from any part of a location for the time being so occupied by another person; at all times while trading, otherwise occupying any location with a view to trading, or moving between locations occupied or to be occupied with a view to trading, he must display prominently his certi cate granted under the pedlars act . manchester city council act nothing in sub paragraph to above disquali es any person from occupying a location within a minimum distance for the purpose of trading if he so occupies it on the request of a bona de customer, he begins trading on arrival there, and he leaves as soon as he is able after trading ceases. for the purposes of sub paragraphs and above a person is trading from such time as, while falling within sub paragraph or , he commences the transaction of selling goods to a bona de customer, or of supplying a service for payment by a bona de customer, up to the moment when the transaction is completed or aborted but, if another bona de customer is waiting to trade with him at that moment, time shall not be treated as elapsing in any gap between that moment and the commencement of the transaction with the other customer; and measurement of minimum distance operates in a straight line except to the extent that the ground is not level, or passage along the line is obstructed by buildings, xed structures or private property . nothing in subsection shall be taken to extend the range of activities that comprise acting as a pedlar. seizure and forfeiture seizure subject to the following provisions of this section, if an authorised of cer or a constable has reasonable grounds for believing that a person has committed a relevant offence, the authorised of cer or constable may seize any article in relation to which he believes an offence has been committed and which is being offered or exposed for sale or displayed; or any other article which is in the possession of or under the control of any person who is offering or exposing for sale or displaying an article; and is of a similar nature to the article being offered or exposed for sale or displayed, as the case may be; or any receptacle or equipment being used by that person. no article, receptacle or equipment shall be seized under subsection unless the conditions of subsection apply. manchester city council act the conditions are that the article, receptacle or equipment may be required to be used in evidence in any proceedings in respect of the suspected offence; or the subject of forfeiture under section ; and in the case of an article is not of a perishable nature. an authorised of cer shall produce his authority if required to do so by the person having care or control of anything seized in pursuance of the powers in subsection . an authorised of cer or a constable shall, forthwith after seizing any article, receptacle or equipment under subsection , give to the person from whom the article, receptacle or equipment was seized a document containing the following information the name and address of the person who the authorised of cer or constable believes has committed the offence; if different from the name and address of the person mentioned in paragraph , the name and address of the owner of the article, receptacle or equipment; the type of article, receptacle or equipment seized; and information about section . if an authorised of cer or constable is unable, after reasonable enquiry of the person who he believes has committed the offence, to ascertain the name or address of that person; or the owner of the article, receptacle or equipment, or has reasonable cause to believe that a name or address provided to him is incorrect, he need not comply with paragraph or , as the case may be, of subsection . the authorised of cer or constable shall, before the end of the period of days beginning with the date of seizure, give or serve a copy of the document to or on any person who is named on the document under subsection at the address shown on the document. return and disposal of seized items the following provisions of this section shall have effect where any article, receptacle or equipment is seized under section and references in those provisions to proceedings are to proceedings in respect of the alleged offence in relation to which the article, receptacle or equipment is seized. subject to subsections to , following the conclusion of the proceedings the article, receptacle or equipment shall be returned to the person from whom it was seized unless the court orders it to be forfeited under section ; or any award of costs to the council by the court have not been paid within days of the making of the order. manchester city council act if at the end of the period of days beginning with the date of seizure no proceedings have been instituted; or any proceedings instituted within that period have been discontinued; or at any time after the end of that period any such proceedings are discontinued, the article, receptacle or equipment shall, at the appropriate time, be returned to the person from whom it was seized unless it has not proved possible, after reasonable enquiry, to identify that person and ascertain his address. in subsection , the appropriate time means in the case of paragraph , the end of the period of days mentioned in that paragraph; in the case of paragraph , the time when proceedings are discontinued. where the article, receptacle or equipment is not returned because it has not proved possible to identify the person from whom it was seized and ascertain his address, the council or the chief constable may apply to a magistrates court for an order as to the manner in which it should be dealt with. where after the expiry of the period of days mentioned in subsection , any costs awarded by the court to the council have not been paid to the council in full the article, receptacle or equipment may be disposed of in any way the council thinks t; and any sum obtained by the council in excess of the costs awarded by the court shall be paid to the person to whom the article, receptacle or equipment belongs. when any article, receptacle or equipment is disposed of by the council under subsection the council shall secure the best possible price which can reasonably be obtained for it. forfeiture of seized items subject to subsection , the court by or before which a person is convicted of a relevant offence may order any article, receptacle or equipment produced to the court; and shown to the satisfaction of the court to relate to the offence, to be forfeited and dealt with in such a manner as the court may order. the court shall not order any article, receptacle or equipment to be forfeited under subsection where a person claiming to be the owner of or otherwise interested in it applies to be heard by the court, unless an opportunity has been given to him to show cause why the order should not be made. manchester city council act in considering whether to make an order under subsection a court shall have regard to the value of the article, receptacle or equipment; and to the likely nancial and other effects on the offender; or the owner of the article, receptacle or equipment, of the making of the order . compensation where seizure unlawful subsection shall have effect where any article, receptacle or equipment is seized under section ; and any of the following applies not less than six months have passed since the date of the seizure and no information has been laid against any person for a relevant offence in respect of the act or circumstances which occasioned the seizure; proceedings for a relevant offence have been brought and the person charged has been acquitted ; proceedings for a relevant offence have been brought and the proceedings have been withdrawn by, or have failed for want of prosecution by, the person by whom the proceedings were brought. where this subsection has effect a person who has or at the time of seizure had a legal interest in the article, receptacle or equipment seized may recover compensation from the council or the chief constable by civil action in the county court in respect of any loss suffered by him as a result of the seizure. the court may only make an order for compensation under subsection if satis ed that seizure was not lawful under section . a crown copyright printed in the uk by the stationery of ce limited under the authority and superintendence of carol tullo, controller of her majesty s stationery of ce and queen s printer of acts of parliament

Unnamed: 6: as follows first group of parts introductory provisions and overview part introductory provisions and overview overview parts to of this act together make up a code called the sentencing code . they deal with the following matters. before sentencing part is about powers exercisable by a court before passing sentence. sentencing part is about court procedure when sentencing. part is about the discretion a court has when sentencing. sentences part is about absolute and conditional discharges. b sentencing bill hl part introductory provisions and overview part is about orders relating to conduct. part is about fines and other orders relating to property. part is about disqualification. part is about community sentences. part is about custodial sentences. part is about behaviour orders. general part contains miscellaneous and general provision about sentencing. part deals with interpretation. part of this act contains supplementary provision. for other provision that may be relevant in relation to sentencing
Unnamed: 8: and sentencing guidelines. application of code the sentencing code does not apply where a person is convicted of an offence before the commencement date. accordingly
Unnamed: 9: any provision that corresponds to a provision of the sentencing code continues on and after that date to have effect as regards dealing with a person for an offence of which the person was convicted before that date
Unnamed: 10: and in relation to a sentence passed for an offence of which the person was convicted before that date. where on or after that date a court is dealing with a person in relation to an offence of which the person was convicted before that date and is required to treat the person as just convicted of the offence
Unnamed: 11: the requirement does not mean that subsection no longer applies. sentencing bill hl part introductory provisions and overview second group of parts provisions applying to sentencing courts generally part powers exercisable before passing sentence chapter deferment of sentence deferment order in this code deferment order means an order deferring passing sentence on an offender in respect of one or more offences until the date specified in the order
Unnamed: 14: to have regard to the offender s conduct after conviction
Unnamed: 15: or any change in the offender s circumstances. a deferment order may impose requirements as to the offender s conduct during the period of deferment. deferment requirements may include requirements as to the residence of the offender during all or part of the period of deferment; restorative justice requirements. availability of deferment order a deferment order is available to the crown court or a magistrates court in respect of an offence where the offender is before the court to be dealt with for the offence
Unnamed: 16: and no previous deferment order has been made in respect of the offence. see also section . but a deferment order is not available to a magistrates court dealing with an offender in respect of an offence for which section requires the court to make a referral order. making a deferment order a court may make a deferment order in respect of an offence only if the offender consents
Unnamed: 17: the offender undertakes to comply with any deferment requirements the court proposes to impose

Unnamed: 20: and sentencing bill hl part powers exercisable before passing sentence chapter deferment of sentence the court is satisfied
Unnamed: 21: having regard to the nature of the offence and the character and circumstances of the offender

product movement function means a function relating to the movement of fishery products into or out of the united kingdom, or within the united kingdom. fisheries bill hl before clause insert the following new clause foreign fishing boats that are exclusively faroe islands regulated no prohibition, restriction or obligation relating to sea fishing imposed by any enactment applies to anything done or not done by or in relation to a foreign fishing boat at a time at which the fishing boat is in waters lying within the special area and is exclusively faroe islands regulated, or anything done or not done in relation to sea fish that were caught by a foreign fishing boat in waters lying within the special area at a time at which the fishing boat was exclusively faroe islands regulated. for the purposes of this section a foreign fishing boat is exclusively faroe islands regulated if there is in force a licence issued by or on behalf of the government of the faroe islands authorising it to fish in waters lying within the special area, and the fishing boat is not on a list maintained and published by the scottish ministers for the purposes of this subsection. in this section enactment has the same meaning as in the european union act and includes an enactment contained in or made under this act; the special area means the special area, as defined in article of, and schedule c to, the faroe islands treaty; the faroe islands treaty means the agreement between the government of the united kingdom, and the government of the kingdom of denmark together with the home government of the faroe islands, relating to the maritime delimitation in the area between the faroe islands and the united kingdom, entered into on may . after clause insert the following new clause interpretation of welsh legislation in the interpretation act , section b , as substituted by paragraph of schedule to the legislation act , is amended in accordance with subsections and . in subsection , for and wales substitute , welsh zone and wales . after subsection insert in relation to a provision that relates to fishing, fisheries or fish health, and is contained in an instrument made after section of the fisheries act comes into force, fisheries bill hl wales includes the area of the welsh zone beyond the seaward limit of the territorial sea. the legislation act is amended in accordance with subsections to . in section in the english language text, omit applies in relation to wales and relates to subject matter which ; london local authorities and transport for london bill hl to be attached, and information on how representations can be made about the propo sal. provisions about compensation are also made in relation to damage caused by the affixing of traffic signs. similar provisions are already contained in the existing legisla tion relating to street lamps. clause makes provision about the service of notices under clause . clause makes provision about damage to highways caused as a result of the carrying out of works on land adjacent to the highway. section of the highways act provides for the recovery of expenses incurred by a highway authority incurred in remedying damage to a footway caused by or as a consequence of the carrying out of works on land adjoining it. clause would replace section with provisions for london that would enable the highway authority to recover their expenses of remedying such damage to any part of the highway, not just the footway. part builders skips part makes provision about the depositing of builders skips on the highway in lon don. the depositing of builders skips is already controlled under sections to a of the highways act . those sections provide that the permission of the highway authority is required before any builder s skip is placed on the highway. the highway authority can place conditions on the permission including conditions relating to the lighting and guarding of the skip. there are also provisions in the act requiring the owner of a builder s skip to secure that the skip is properly lighted during the hours of darkness, and that any regulations made by the secretary of state about the marking of the skip are properly complied with. responsibility for ensuring compliance with the provisions of section of the highways act lies with the owner of the builder s skip and that term is defined in section . it provides that the owner, in relation to a builder s skip which is the subject of a hiring agreement of not less than one month, or a hire purchase agreement, means the person in possession of the skip under the agreement. failure to comply with the provisions of section is a criminal offence for which the owner is liable. clause makes provision for the interpretation of terms in part . clause enables a highway authority to require the relevant person to provide them with information about who the owner of the skip is, in order to determine who penalty charge notices should be served on in respect of decriminalised contraventions of the highways act . the relevant person is defined as the person to whom permission was given under section of the highways act, or the person from whom the skip was hired, or the bailor in a hire purchase agreement. it would be an offence to fail to comply with the authority s request for information within the specified compliance period, or to give false information. clause makes provision for the decriminalisation of offences under section of the highways act as it applies in london. under part of the london local authori ties act , a regime for the administration of decriminalised offences is set out in london local authorities and transport for london bill hl some detail.clause would have the effect of applying those detailed provisions to decriminalised offences under section . clause provides that the owner of the buil der s skip would be liable to pay any penalty charge arising from a contravention of a decriminalised offence. if the skip is hired out to ano ther person, then the owner would be able to recover penalty charges from the hirer. the provisions of the act of will allow representations to be made against the imposition of penalty charge, and appeals to be made to an adjudicator. the grounds for making such representations and appeals are set out in subsection of clause . clause alters the powers of the highway authority to place conditions on the giving of a permission for placing a skip on the highway. it will enable the authority to include a condition that the skip has lights or a guard or system of guarding that is an integral part of the skip. clause provides highway authorities with powers to light and cover skips in cases where requirements as to lighting and covering have not been complied with. the clause enables the highway authority to recover any expenses reasonably incurred in lighting or covering the skip. clause would enable a highway authority to fix an immobilisation device to a skip in cases where they have also served a penalty charge notice . the clause also makes requirements of the authority to affix a notice to the skip providing informa tion about how to secure its removal and there are offences for unlawfully removing the skip or the notice. clause sets out the circumstances under which a skip will be released from an immo bilisation device. it will be removed when the penalty charge and a release fee are paid. clause makes additional provision about appeals against penalty charges in cases where a skip has been immobilised under clause . it provides that where representa tions or an appeal have been made successfully, the highway authority must refund any charges made for the release of the skip as well as the penalty charge for the contra vention. part road traffic part contains a single provision relating to road traffic. clause deals with cases where the local traffic authority has made a road traffic regu lation order under the road traffic regulation act so as to prevent the passage of vehicles or any class of vehicles into out of or along a highway, and has also placed a gate or other barrier on the highway to ensure that the order is complied with. someti mes the barriers are authorised to be opened, for example, by the emergency services. whilst it is an offence to drive along the road in breach of the road traffic regulation order, it is not an offence to interfere with the barrier unless criminal damage is caused. clause makes it an offence to open, close or otherwise interfere with a barrier without lawful excuse. london local authorities and transport for london bill hl part charging points for electric vehicles part enables londonauthoritiestoprovideandoperate chargingapparatusforelectri cally powered motor vehicles on highways. clause been deposited on a highway in accordance with a permission granted under the said section but the owner of the skip does not secure that the skip is properly lighted during the hours of darkness; the
